segment.source: App-V 4.6 SP1 Release Notes
segment.target: App-V 4.6 SP1 Release Notes

segment.source: App-V 4.6 SP1 Release Notes
segment.target: App-V 4.6 SP1 Release Notes

segment.source: App-V 4.6 SP1 Release Notes
segment.target: App-V 4.6 SP1 Release Notes

segment.source: To search these Release Notes, press CTRL+F.
segment.target: To search these Release Notes, press CTRL+F.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: Read these Release Notes thoroughly before you install the Microsoft Application Virtualization (App-V) Management System.
segment.target: Read these Release Notes thoroughly before you install the Microsoft Application Virtualization (App-V) Management System.

segment.source: These Release Notes contain information that helps you successfully install Application Virtualization (App-V) 4.6 SP1.
segment.target: These Release Notes contain information that helps you successfully install Application Virtualization (App-V) 4.6 SP1.

segment.source: This document contains information that is not available in the product documentation.
segment.target: This document contains information that is not available in the product documentation.

segment.source: If there is a difference between these Release Notes and other App-V documentation, the latest change should be considered authoritative.
segment.target: If there is a difference between these Release Notes and other App-V documentation, the latest change should be considered authoritative.

segment.source: Protect Against Security Vulnerabilities and Viruses
segment.target: Protect Against Security Vulnerabilities and Viruses

segment.source: To help protect against security vulnerabilities and viruses, it is important to install the latest available security updates for any new software being installed.
segment.target: To help protect against security vulnerabilities and viruses, it is important to install the latest available security updates for any new software being installed.

segment.source: For more information, see the Microsoft Security website (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=3482).
segment.target: For more information, see the Microsoft Security website (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=3482).

segment.source: Known Issues with Application Virtualization 4.6 SP1
segment.target: Known Issues with Application Virtualization 4.6 SP1

segment.source: This section provides the most up-to-date information about issues with Microsoft Application Virtualization (App-V) 4.6 SP1.
segment.target: This section provides the most up-to-date information about issues with Microsoft Application Virtualization (App-V) 4.6 SP1.

segment.source: These issues do not appear in the product documentation and in some cases might contradict existing product documentation.
segment.target: These issues do not appear in the product documentation and in some cases might contradict existing product documentation.

segment.source: When it is possible, these issues will be addressed in later releases.
segment.target: When it is possible, these issues will be addressed in later releases.

segment.source: Path from SPRT is lost if it does not end in forward slash ( / )
segment.target: Path from SPRT is lost if it does not end in forward slash ( / )

segment.source: When the path in an HREF in a project template does not end with a forward slash (), the generated HREF does not include the path.
segment.target: When the path in an HREF in a project template does not end with a forward slash (), the generated HREF does not include the path.

segment.source: This occurs when the user manually manipulates the .sprt file.
segment.target: This occurs when the user manually manipulates the .sprt file.

segment.source: If you use the sequencer it always adds the forward slash () after the path.
segment.target: If you use the sequencer it always adds the forward slash () after the path.

segment.source: WORKAROUND Make sure that the HREF has a trailing forward slash ().
segment.target: WORKAROUND Make sure that the HREF has a trailing forward slash ().

segment.source: User folder name do not correspond to the package name
segment.target: User folder name do not correspond to the package name

segment.source: Folders that contain user and global .pkg files no longer include the package name.
segment.target: Folders that contain user and global .pkg files no longer include the package name.

segment.source: Previously, the App-V client used to use the package root folder 8.3 short name as part of the folder name.
segment.target: Previously, the App-V client used to use the package root folder 8.3 short name as part of the folder name.

segment.source: This lets you easily identify it.
segment.target: This lets you easily identify it.

segment.source: When you use the App-V 4.6 SP1 sequencer, the package root folder 8.3 short names are now random strings.
segment.target: When you use the App-V 4.6 SP1 sequencer, the package root folder 8.3 short names are now random strings.

segment.source: This makes it difficult to identify the folders that contain the package’s .pkg files on the computer that is running the App-V client.
segment.target: This makes it difficult to identify the folders that contain the package’s .pkg files on the computer that is running the App-V client.

segment.source: WORKAROUND Use one of the following methods to more easily identify these package folders:
segment.target: WORKAROUND Use one of the following methods to more easily identify these package folders:

segment.source: When you create the package by using the Sequencer, specify a folder name that follows the 8.3 naming convention for the primary application folder.
segment.target: When you create the package by using the Sequencer, specify a folder name that follows the 8.3 naming convention for the primary application folder.

segment.source: This name will then be used as part of the user folder name as was the case in App-V 4.6.
segment.target: This name will then be used as part of the user folder name as was the case in App-V 4.6.

segment.source: The .sprj file now contains a tag that displays the string that is used as the beginning of the user folder name.
segment.target: The .sprj file now contains a tag that displays the string that is used as the beginning of the user folder name.

segment.source: You can use the SHORTNAME element of the PACKAGEROOTFOLDER element to determine the name.
segment.target: You can use the SHORTNAME element of the PACKAGEROOTFOLDER element to determine the name.

segment.source: Running App-V 4.6 SP1 on computers that have more than 64 processors
segment.target: Running App-V 4.6 SP1 on computers that have more than 64 processors

segment.source: When you run App-V 4.6 SP1 on computers that have more than 64 processors installed, the App-V client fails.
segment.target: When you run App-V 4.6 SP1 on computers that have more than 64 processors installed, the App-V client fails.

segment.source: WORKAROUND None.
segment.target: WORKAROUND None.

segment.source: This configuration is not supported.
segment.target: This configuration is not supported.

segment.source: You must run App-V 4.6 SP1on computers that have fewer than 64 processors.
segment.target: You must run App-V 4.6 SP1on computers that have fewer than 64 processors.

segment.source: Application Virtualization 4.6 SP1 update is not offered on all locales that use Microsoft Update
segment.target: Application Virtualization 4.6 SP1 update is not offered on all locales that use Microsoft Update

segment.source: When you use Microsoft Update, the update for App-V 4.6 SP1 is not available for the following language locales:
segment.target: When you use Microsoft Update, the update for App-V 4.6 SP1 is not available for the following language locales:

segment.source: Kazakh
segment.target: Kazakh

segment.source: Hindi
segment.target: Hindi

segment.source: Serbian-Cyrillic
segment.target: Serbian-Cyrillic

segment.source: WORKAROUND If you are using Microsoft Windows Server Update Services (WSUS) use the English version of the update or download the update from the Microsoft Update Catalog.
segment.target: WORKAROUND If you are using Microsoft Windows Server Update Services (WSUS) use the English version of the update or download the update from the Microsoft Update Catalog.

segment.source: After expanding the parent package, you cannot sequence a plug-in with side by side components
segment.target: After expanding the parent package, you cannot sequence a plug-in with side by side components

segment.source: When you expand a parent package by using ToolsExpand Package to Local System in the App-V Sequencer console and you sequence a plug-in with side by side components, an installation error is returned.
segment.target: When you expand a parent package by using ToolsExpand Package to Local System in the App-V Sequencer console and you sequence a plug-in with side by side components, an installation error is returned.

segment.source: For example:
segment.target: For example:

segment.source: HRESULT 0x80073712
segment.target: HRESULT 0x80073712

segment.source: This is caused when the sequencer writes the side-by-side component to the registry but does not clear the value for the following registry key:
segment.target: This is caused when the sequencer writes the side-by-side component to the registry but does not clear the value for the following registry key:

segment.source: HKEYLOCALMACHINECOMPONENTSStoreDirty
segment.target: HKEYLOCALMACHINECOMPONENTSStoreDirty

segment.source: WORKAROUND After expanding the parent package on the computer that is running the sequencer, you have to delete the value for the following registry key:
segment.target: WORKAROUND After expanding the parent package on the computer that is running the sequencer, you have to delete the value for the following registry key:

segment.source: HKEYLOCALMACHINECOMPONENTSStoreDirty
segment.target: HKEYLOCALMACHINECOMPONENTSStoreDirty

segment.source: After you have deleted the value, sequence the plug-in.
segment.target: After you have deleted the value, sequence the plug-in.
